sec.p: The bacteria used in this study were included S. aureus ATCC6538, S. epidermidis ATCC12228, S. pyogenes ATCC19615, P. aeruginosa ATCC15442, and E. coli ATCC11303. The strains were maintained in BHI (Brain Heart Infusion-Difco®) + glycerol (20%) at -80°C. To perform the experiments, a 100 μl aliquot was inoculated onto TSA medium ( Trypticase Soy Agar-Difco®) and grown in a greenhouse at 37°C for 24 h. After this initial growth, a 100 μl inoculum was subcultured into 10 ml of TSB ( Trypticase Soy Broth- Difco®) and grown for 18 h under the same conditions described above. In the antimicrobial activity assays, the cultures were washed with Mili-Rios water and their concentrations were adjusted to 10 7-10 8 CFU/ml using a microplate reader (SpectraMax i3 Multi-Mode Microplate Reader®) at 620 nm.
